intro: Asterochiton, commonly known as the star chiton, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the daisy family. The leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and often hairy, providing a textured appearance. Asterochiton species are native to various regions in South America, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. These plants are adapted to thrive in harsh conditions, showcasing resilience and ecological significance in their native habitats.
